reviews.review: Best video game of all time, save for Half-Life 2(and possibly Half-Life: Alyx!)!

Yo no tuve la oprtunidad de jugar este juego en su época, sabiendo que pude jugar la versión source, me decidí por jugar la versión original ya que queria tener la experiencia original del juego.
En cuanto a la historia del juego la verdad me tiene intrigado ya que siguo sin saber cual era el objetivo de crear un portal a otro mundo.
Las mecanicas son excelentes, digno de valve como uno de sus primeros juegos.

Si te gustan los juegos con una historia profunda y mecancas increibles, enemigos extraños, este es tu juego.

well, what can I say? It's half-life. It's the very reason I even got into video games in the first place. The story is incredulous, the voice acting is 'top notch' and the multiplayer was such a blast for me back then. I would play this game with my brother and father countless times (not on multiplayer, we would sit at our family computer and take turns on who would play.) I remember dying so many times, but I didn't care, I was having fun hearing the HEV suit flat-lining. It made my entire childhood complete. I'm going to give this game a 10/10 (graphics haven't really aged well sadly.)

The very jewel of Valve. A Step Far Long in the story of FPS. A Memorable Masterpiece. One of your best shots none the less.

The game is a classic, and is still great fun to this day. It has of course aged quite a bit, not the graphics, but the amount of jumping puzzles in the game. You will miss your landings and fall down to your death throughout the game. But playing the game is worth it, and tonnes of mods await you on Moddb.com .
So what are you waiting for? Half-Life 3? Buy it!

Overall a great game . If you are a fan of half life then this is a must . But if you never played half life before, then it might be a bit hard and boring for new players since the game is qute old and not much online server left.

Simplemente Half-Life... Este gran titulo me lleva de vuelta a mi infancia con sus gráficos de vieja escuela, y una programación impecable para la época, y una trama envolvente que no da lugar al aburrimiento.
A certified classic, and some of the mods are fire.

Pretty much all of Half-Life's praises have been sung over the past 21 years, so there isn't much for me to add at this point other than a recommendation. The storytelling is exquisite in its subtlety, and the gameplay is genuinely challenging and rewarding. Although the graphics and sound haven't aged well, this was really intense for the time, and deserves to be played by everyone today. Half-Life is a cornerstone of several generations of video games, and I highly recommend you give it a playthrough if you haven't already.
Definiu o gênero FPS, e consegue se manter divertido e empolgante 21 anos depois de seu lançamento. Sem comentários, uma obra-prima.
Capolavoro assoluto. Da avere insieme al 2

[h1] 23 and still kickin [/h1] 

[b] Gameplay [/b] 
There's 14 different weapons and they have quite some use. For example, the pistol in other games generally becomes useless after you get other weapons, but here the pistol stays useful for precise, accurate shots from far away.

The tau cannon is an experimental uranium weapon that doesn't ever need to be reloaded, fires rapidly, and has two fire modes. The second mode will fire a STRONG beam of energy that will knock you back, but proves very effective towards helicopters.

The MP5 is great for taking out enemies quickly, and the second mode launches a grenade which is great for crowd control.

And the snarks are little bugs [b](insects)[/b] that can be deployed to greatly mess up enemy group formations. If there aren't any enemies around, they'll come back and attack you. See what I mean? I wish more games had cool weapons and items like this, so I applaud Half-Life and one of it's few traits this game has over it's sequel

[b] Graphics [/b] 
This game is from 1998, so it's obviously going to look old. That doesn't mean it looks bad though. I'd recommend [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2303784937] turning off texture filtering [/url] for a pristine look.

In 2001, Gearbox [b] (the same Gearbox that made Borderlands) [/b] released an expansion called Half-Life: Blue Shift. This introduced higher quality models that were ported over to Half-Life and their other expansion, Opposing Force.
People like to complain about it, for reasons that make sense, and for some that don't, like;
[list]
    [*]The higher-poly models [b] (don't expect premium quality, they're from 2001) [/b] clash with the then-dated models of the game. I can respect this one because it's true, but maybe just disable the pack then??
    [*]It's default, so most new-players won't know about the older models.. ok? You can still love Half-Life and use the new models.
    [*]They change the actual guns themselves, like the Glock to a Beretta, and the MP5 to a.. M16 assault rifle?? Now the assault rifles use the same ammo as the pistol, which makes little to no sense.
[/list]  
But remember: you can [b]ALWAYS[/b] turn it off, so I don't think it's as big of a deal as people make it out to be.

[b] Spec requirements [/b] 
If your computer doesn't predate the late 90's, you can run Half-Life.
Something great about a game this old is that level transitions load fast. The most it should ever take is 5 seconds.

[b] Difficulty [/b]
The amount of items you get or damage you take is affected by what difficulty you choose. I'd recommend playing through the Hazard Course before playing so you get the hang of movement, especially crouch jumping if you aren't used to that in other games.
[url=combineoverwiki.net/wiki/Difficulty_settings_(Half-Life)] You can read more about difficulty here [/url]

[b] Story [/b]
Half-Life presents it's story in a way many games didn't do (and still don't do) at the time. Instead of taking away your control and forcing you to watch a cutscene, Half-Life has it happen right in front of you.

Gordon never talks, and since you have the ability to kill neutral characters, you can be your friendly-neighborhood Gordon, or be a psychopath and light up everybody you see.

[b] Bugs [/b]
The game is old. Of course you're going to encounter bugs.

[b] So, overall? [/b]
The game is great to this day, however do be warned.. the last few chapters are easily the worst part about the game
this game is older than me, but more fun than more recent games

[h1]Lendário, [i]Half-Life[/i] ainda é atual e obrigatório[/h1]

Lançado na época de ouro do survival horror, contemporâneo de jogos como [i]Resident Evil[/i], [i]Silent Hill[/i], [i]Dino Crisis[/i] e [i]System Shock 2[/i], [i]Half-Life[/i] é único. Com uma narrativa espetacular, digna dos livros mais distópicos possíveis, o jogo criado pela Valve inaugurou uma revolução nos FPSs. Nunca os inimigos foram tão espertos. Nunca a história se desenvolveu sem uma cut-scene (ou similares) e nunca o ambiente foi tão conectado do início ao fim.

Não basta que você atire freneticamente, é preciso que você saiba sobreviver. Mas sobreviver não é correr ou se esconder, é agir com a cabeça, resolver um puzzle, fazer uma gambiarra, utilizar do terreno pra matar algum boss. Definitivamente você não é fodão, mas só um pouquinho esperto (se não for, perdeu). Tudo isso não poderia ser simbolizado por outra arma que não um pé-de-cabra.

O humor é negro, os personagens são estranhos, terrivelmente humanos, cientistas amedrontados, deslocados do mundo, uma confusão real que coloca no jogador uma confusão mental, sem saber o que se passa efetivamente em Black Mesa.

Pode não ter sido tão revolucionário como [i]Goldeneye[/i], ainda assim [i]Half-Life[/i] está no panteão dos FPS, quiçá encabeçando com rei dos reis.

I could never understand what so amazing about this game, every time I try it everything about is just plain annoying to me. 
First things first, the movement is just godawful, your character has this ridiculous momentum and slide a bit every time you come to a stop its absolutely infuriating constantly messing up shots and making the platforming way more frustrating than needed, I mean why would you even have such a movement system with paltforming!? Its moronic. 
Next, enemies are a chore, they're all sponges and feel like they have a bit more health than they need to, they also make no animations when you hit them so sometimes your really wondering if you're actually doing anything as you empty a whole magazine of ammunition into soldier as he fires at you non-stop completely unaffected. The stupid soldiers are some the most un-fun stupid enemies ever, they're all hitscan and take ton of damage they're basically aimbots to boot so forget outrunning their aim you basically forced to play stealthily and hide behind cover constantly to take care of them without getting your health melted. 
Memorization game, this game really promotes save scumming, theres alot of scripted stuff and just dickish enemy placement that totally screw you over without knowing whats going to happen, so if you don't already know whats coming up your probably gonna die and have to start over from a previous save as just a out of sight soldier placement can melt you pretty quick or some dumb scripted event happens and if you don't react the exact right way or don't have you're screwed. 
I'm guessing this game was a big deal because it spawned a lot of popular multiplayer mods and people were tired of the fantasy/scifi heavy FPS games and thought something more narrative driven with more grounded atmosphere and realistic guns was a good change of pace, I guess there's the technical impression as well, but in the current year I can only judge it on its actual gameplay and personal fun factor, Unreal came out earlier the same year as Half-Life and imo is an amazing game, much-much more fun than Half-Life, I'd suggest playing that instead.

There are few games as well designed as Half-Life. Not only there's a nice selection of weapons, both conventional and experimental, and hordes of horrific enemies, but it's all wrapped in a very interesting setting. However, the greatest strength of the game for me is the pacing; there isn't a dull moment in the game unless you get stuck and there's a surprising amount of variety for the main campaign. 
The only downside to me are the vehicle segments, which I've never enjoyed, and that enemies are too spongy in the highest difficulty.
